data.text:
Establishment of Registro Italiano Navale

The classification society was established in Genoa, Italy: in the very first year of operations, our 13 agencies classed 340 vessels

Consolidation and development

Initial consolidation and development stage, with an exponential increase in our coverage of the Italian territory: five years after the establishment, our 49 agencies classed 1,500 vessels

International agreements

The first international agreements were signed with the British Corporation Register, the American Bureau of Shipping and Teikoku Kaiji Kyokai, for mutual representation in the respective countries and harmonisation of the rules and regulations

New organisational structure

Registro Nazionale Italiano merged with Veritas Adriatico, successor to the Austro-Hungarian Veritas. From then on, Registro Navale was located in two different offices: administration stayed in Genoa, and the registered office moved to Rome

New international agreements

New mutual agreements with other classification registers. We joined the International Institute of Welding (IIW), the International Standardization Organization (ISO), the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) and the International Ship Structures Congress (ISSC)

Entry into the industrial field

Registro Nazionale expanded its technical structure: a special group was formed to acquire and deliver industrial services, to cope with the changed merchant marine needs corresponding to the rapid developments of associated industrial technology

New acquisitions

We acquired D’Appolonia S.p.A., a Genoa-based company dealing with consultancy services, and Simtex S.r.l., a leading private body in Romania for the certification of company management systems and products

A multinational Group

We adopted a new structure, including the holding RINA S.p.A. and two business branches managed by RINA Services S.p.A. and D’Appolonia S.p.A.

Centro Sviluppo Materiali

We opened up to a new market by acquiring Centro Sviluppo Materiali, a research centre which develops advanced technological solutions related to materials, in particular steel and special alloys

New financial partner

Intesa Sanpaolo – through the Merchant Banking Management of its Corporate and Investment Banking Division – and VEI Capital - investment company of Palladio Finanziaria in the Private Equity Mid-Cap segment – agreed to buy a stake in RINA S.p.A.

An established structure in the USA

A new company became part of us: QIC Inc, a leading TIC company serving major and independent operators as well as manufacturers in the Oil & Gas industry

A Group in constant growth

We acquired the entire share capital of Edif, a worldwide provider of a diverse range of TIC-CE services that serve to reduce risk, optimise performance and enhance the capability of its clients’ assets

Comprising all the consulting companies

D’Appolonia S.p.A. became RINA Consulting S.p.A., a legal entity that integrates all our companies involved in the consulting business: Centro Sviluppo Materiali, Edif ERA (ERA Technology), G.E.T., Logmarin Advisors, OST Energy, Polaris, SC Sembenelli Consulting and Seatech

RINA. A unique brand

We face a deep and total transformation, acquiring a new identity and comprising more than 150 years of history under a unique brand. This new identity combines tradition and innovation to shape the Excellence Behind Excellence

RINA. Make it Sure. Make it Simple.

We keep evolving because our purpose is to bring together people, the planet and organisations to anticipate the challenges of the future and improve quality of life. To do that, we simplify complexities through our expertise, making what seems impossible, possible.

Strengthening our Space & Defence arm

We acquired the entire share capital of Interconsulting Engineering, headquartered in Rome, through our subsidiary RINA Consulting. This strategic move augments our existing expertise in safety-critical software engineering and complex electronic systems prototyping.
